image.alt: Happy people showing beautiful smiles at McKenna Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: At McKenna Orthodontics, our top priority is to give you the beautiful smile you deserve. Dr. Gregory McKenna and our team care for adults, teens, and children from the Greater Danbury area with attentive, personalized service.

With offices in Danbury and New Fairfield, we combine family-friendly care, modern diagnostics, and convenient scheduling to make your orthodontic experience comfortable and straightforward. Contact either office to schedule your complimentary exam and consultation.

items.title: Family Care
items.text: We provide family-friendly care for adults, teens, and children in a warm, welcoming environment.

items.title: Experienced Team
items.text: Our caring, skilled staff supports each patient through treatment, focusing on comfort and clear communication.

items.title: Advanced Options
items.text: Certified Invisalign<sup>®</sup> providers and Wilckodontics® are among the customized treatment options we offer.

items.title: Digital Care

image.alt: Digital dental imaging and treatment planning

items.text: We use iTero digital scanning, Cone Beam 3D imaging, and other digital tools for faster, more comfortable care.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Gregory McKenna, DMD, MDS, leads McKenna Orthodontics with decades of experience and a family tradition in orthodontics. He earned his DMD at the UConn School of Dental Medicine in 1996 and completed his orthodontic training at the UConn School of Orthodontics in 1999. Dr. McKenna offers advanced options such as Wilckodontics® and cone beam 3D imaging, participates in research, and is active in regional orthodontic societies.

image.alt: Dr. Gregory McKenna, orthodontist at McKenna Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: We offer a full range of orthodontic options, from clear aligners to specialized accelerated treatments and modern digital imaging for accurate diagnosis and comfort.

image.alt: Digital scanning and 3D imaging for orthodontic diagnosis

image.alt: Office exterior and welcoming reception area at McKenna Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: At McKenna Orthodontics, our top priority is to give you the beautiful smile you deserve. We provide family-friendly care for adults, teens, and children, focusing on each patient's unique needs to deliver comfortable, personalized orthodontic treatment.

Our team is dedicated to service and excellent technical care. We carefully sterilize instruments for patient protection and welcome questions so we can build a comprehensive treatment plan that fits your needs and lifestyle. Great dental care supports overall health and confidence, and we want you to feel comfortable sharing your smile with the world.

image.alt: Dr. Gregory McKenna smiling in the office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Gregory McKenna loves creating smiles and brings a warm, family-centered approach to orthodontics. Raised watching his grandfather practice, he continued the family tradition and now practices with the same commitment to compassionate, detail-oriented care.

Dr. McKenna has built a practice focused on patient comfort and predictable results. He uses modern diagnostic tools and proven techniques to plan treatment efficiently and explain options clearly so patients can make confident choices.

image.alt: Dr. Gregory McKenna in his treatment room

paragraphs.text: Gregory McKenna, DMD, MDS, completed his Doctor of Dental Medicine at the UConn School of Dental Medicine in 1996 and his specialty training in orthodontics at the UConn School of Orthodontics in 1999. He has published research in the American Journal of Orthodontics and contributed to NIH studies.

Dr. McKenna is a member of the American Association of Orthodontists, the Northeast Orthodontics Society, and the Connecticut State Dental Association. He offers advanced procedures such as Wilckodontics® and uses cone-beam 3D imaging for improved diagnosis and treatment planning.

Dr. McKenna is active in community outreach and has traveled to the Dominican Republic to provide orthodontic care to underserved populations. He also participates in local study groups and professional societies to stay current and share knowledge with colleagues.

Outside the office he enjoys time with his wife and three children, playing tennis, and coaching youth sports. He brings that same team spirit to his practice, where every staff member plays a role in delivering excellent patient care.

slides.alt: Bright treatment room with modern equipment
Comfortable patient seating and friendly staff
Team assisting a patient during an office visit
iTero digital scanner used for comfortable digital impressions
Cone-beam 3D CT imaging for advanced diagnostics

paragraphs.text: Dr. McKenna has volunteered orthodontic care in the Dominican Republic, bringing treatment to communities with limited access to specialty care. The practice also supports professional development through local study groups and dental societies to improve care for patients across the region.

image.alt: Patient submitting appointment request at McKenna Orthodontics

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first appointment begins with a complete exam and X-rays so Dr. McKenna can evaluate your orthodontic needs. You’ll meet our team, review your dental history, and get a clear explanation of recommended treatment and timing.

Please bring your insurance card and arrive early to finish any paperwork if you haven’t completed forms ahead of time. The initial visit generally takes about one hour and is scheduled in the morning; follow-up visits are every four to six weeks and usually last 20 to 30 minutes.

image.alt: Orthodontic team welcoming a patient for an initial office visit

paragraphs.text: We accept most major dental insurance plans and will file claims electronically to make billing easier for you.
Flexible payment plans and financing options are available. Our treatment coordinator will review costs, insurance coverage, and payment choices so you can pick the option that fits your budget.

Please print and complete the patient information form before your first appointment to speed check‑in. Choose the child or adult version below. If you have trouble opening PDFs, Adobe Reader is available at: http://adobe.com/products/acrobat/readstep2.html

image.alt: Patient filling out new-patient forms online

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Modern metal braces are more comfortable and discreet than ever. Made from high-grade stainless steel, they use brackets and wires to apply gentle, constant force that moves teeth into healthier positions. You can personalize your look with colored elastics while benefiting from a reliable, cost-effective solution.

Self-ligating braces use a built-in clip instead of elastics to hold the wire, which can reduce friction and often means fewer adjustment visits. They come in metal or ceramic options and work well for a wide range of orthodontic needs.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces use tooth-colored or clear materials to blend with your smile, making them a popular cosmetic choice for older teens and adults. They provide effective tooth movement but may require extra care to avoid staining and to protect the brackets from damage.
Clear aligners are a removable, nearly invisible option for many mild to moderate alignment issues. They let you eat and clean normally while offering a comfortable, metal-free experience.

We offer Invisalign<sup>®</sup> treatment using advanced 3D scanning and planning so you can preview likely progress. Aligners require discipline — typically worn about 22 hours a day — but they can fit easily into busy lives with fewer in-office adjustments.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Lingual braces are attached behind the teeth so they remain invisible from the front. They are fully customized for each patient and are a good option for those seeking a discreet fixed appliance, including professionals and performers.
A palatal expander widens the upper jaw by applying gentle, periodic pressure. Your care team will show you how to adjust the appliance and explain the schedule so expansion is gradual and stable.
Position the patient’s head in a well-lit area and locate the keyhole for the expander adjustment.
Place the key into the hole until it sits firmly in place, ready for the turn.
Push the key toward the back of the mouth until the fender rotates and the next hole appears.
Remove the key by pressing back and down; the next hole should now be visible for the next adjustment.

After active treatment, retainers keep teeth in their new positions while bone and soft tissues settle. We offer removable clear retainers, traditional acrylic-and-wire retainers, and fixed bonded retainers based on your needs and lifestyle.
Your team will explain wear schedules and cleaning tips. Proper retainer use is the best way to protect your investment in a healthy, lasting smile.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: Two-phase treatment helps guide jaw growth and create space for erupting permanent teeth. Early (Phase One) care can simplify or shorten later treatment and sometimes prevent extractions or more invasive procedures.
Phase Two begins when most permanent teeth have erupted and usually includes full braces to fine-tune alignment and bite. We’ll monitor progress closely and recommend the right timing for each child.

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about treatment options, appointment scheduling, and payment plans at Lakeshore Orthodontics.

accordion.header: What orthodontic treatments do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We provide traditional braces for all ages, clear Invisalign<sup>®</sup> aligners for discreet treatment, and custom retainers to maintain your new smile.

accordion.header: At what age should my child see an orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends an evaluation by age 7. Early visits help us monitor development and plan for optimal outcomes.

accordion.header: How long does treatment usually take?

paragraphs.text: Treatment times vary, but most patients complete care within 12–24 months. We’ll provide a personalized timeline at your first appointment.

accordion.header: What payment and insurance options are available?

paragraphs.text: We offer flexible monthly payment plans and accept most major dental insurance carriers. Our team will guide you through coverage and financing.

accordion.header: How can I schedule an appointment?

paragraphs.text:
Scheduling is easy 









call or text us at 519-979-5500. We’ll find a convenient time that fits your family’s needs.
